back_cards.definition_en: To remember or bring back to mind.
back_cards.example_en: She tried to recall the details of the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: To officially request the return of a product.
back_cards.example_en: The company recalled the faulty appliances.

back_cards.definition_en: To summon or call back someone or something.
back_cards.example_en: The ambassador was recalled to the capital.

back_cards.definition_en: To retrieve or recover a memory.
back_cards.example_en: He recalled a childhood trip to the beach.

back_cards.definition_en: To revoke or cancel something.
back_cards.example_en: The judge recalled the decision after new evidence.

back_cards.definition_en: To repair or mend something broken.
back_cards.example_en: He fixed the leaky faucet in the kitchen.

back_cards.definition_en: To arrange or organize something.
back_cards.example_en: She fixed a meeting with the client for tomorrow.

back_cards.definition_en: To prepare or make ready, like food.
back_cards.example_en: They fixed a quick dinner for the guests.

back_cards.definition_en: To focus or direct attention.
back_cards.example_en: He fixed his gaze on the distant horizon.

back_cards.definition_en: To set or establish firmly.
back_cards.example_en: The team fixed a deadline for the project.

back_cards.definition_en: Expressing or implying denial or refusal.
back_cards.example_en: She received a negative response to her request.

back_cards.definition_en: Lacking positive qualities or optimism.
back_cards.example_en: His negative attitude affected the team’s morale.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicating the absence of something.
back_cards.example_en: The test result was negative for the virus.

back_cards.definition_en: Related to a number less than zero.
back_cards.example_en: The temperature dropped to negative ten degrees.

back_cards.definition_en: Critical or harmful in effect.
back_cards.example_en: The decision had a negative impact on sales.

back_cards.definition_en: To join or link two or more things.
back_cards.example_en: The bridge connects the two sides of the city.

back_cards.definition_en: To establish communication or contact.
back_cards.example_en: She connected with her friend via video call.

back_cards.definition_en: To associate or relate ideas or concepts.
back_cards.example_en: He connected the theory to real-world examples.

back_cards.definition_en: To form a personal or emotional bond.
back_cards.example_en: They connected over their love for music.

back_cards.definition_en: To attach to a network or system.
back_cards.example_en: The device failed to connect to the Wi-Fi.

back_cards.definition_en: The space between two points or places.
back_cards.example_en: The distance between the towns is ten miles.

back_cards.definition_en: A measure of separation in time or relationship.
back_cards.example_en: Time created a distance between old friends.

back_cards.definition_en: A far-off place or remote area.
back_cards.example_en: She gazed into the distance, lost in thought.

back_cards.definition_en: The extent of progress or difference.
back_cards.example_en: The team covered a lot of distance this year.

back_cards.definition_en: A sense of emotional or social separation.
back_cards.example_en: He kept his distance during the argument.

back_cards.definition_en: Occurring at fixed or consistent intervals.
back_cards.example_en: She attends regular meetings every Monday.

back_cards.definition_en: Conforming to a standard or usual pattern.
back_cards.example_en: He ordered his regular coffee at the café.

back_cards.definition_en: Ordinary or typical, without special status.
back_cards.example_en: The store serves regular customers all day.

back_cards.definition_en: Even or uniform in shape or structure.
back_cards.example_en: The tiles were cut into regular squares.

back_cards.definition_en: Following established rules or norms.
back_cards.example_en: The game was played under regular conditions.

back_cards.definition_en: The typical weather conditions of an area.
back_cards.example_en: The tropical climate brings heavy rain yearly.

back_cards.definition_en: The prevailing mood or atmosphere.
back_cards.example_en: The climate in the office was tense today.

back_cards.definition_en: Environmental conditions affecting life.
back_cards.example_en: The changing climate impacts local wildlife.

back_cards.definition_en: A region characterized by its weather.
back_cards.example_en: They moved to a warmer climate for health.

back_cards.definition_en: The context or attitude of a group.
back_cards.example_en: A climate of trust grew among the team.

back_cards.definition_en: A connection or association between things.
back_cards.example_en: There’s a relation between diet and health.

back_cards.definition_en: A family member or relative.
back_cards.example_en: She invited all her relations to the wedding.

back_cards.definition_en: The way people or groups interact.
back_cards.example_en: Their relation improved after the discussion.

back_cards.definition_en: A reference or regard to something.
back_cards.example_en: The decision was made in relation to costs.

back_cards.definition_en: A narrative or account of events.
back_cards.example_en: His relation of the trip was fascinating.

back_cards.definition_en: A journey made by an aircraft.
back_cards.example_en: Her flight to Paris leaves at noon.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of flying through the air.
back_cards.example_en: The bird’s flight was graceful and swift.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of things moving together.
back_cards.example_en: A flight of geese passed overhead.

back_cards.definition_en: An escape or quick departure.
back_cards.example_en: His flight from danger saved his life.

back_cards.definition_en: A set of stairs between floors.
back_cards.example_en: She climbed a flight of steps to the office.

back_cards.definition_en: Likely to cause harm or injury.
back_cards.example_en: The steep cliff was dangerous to climb.

back_cards.definition_en: Involving risk or threat.
back_cards.example_en: Driving in the storm was dangerous.

back_cards.definition_en: Capable of causing trouble or problems.
back_cards.example_en: His dangerous ideas stirred controversy.

back_cards.definition_en: Threatening to safety or security.
back_cards.example_en: The chemical was labeled as dangerous.

back_cards.definition_en: Exciting but risky in nature.
back_cards.example_en: The dangerous mission thrilled the adventurers.

back_cards.definition_en: A small vessel for traveling on water.
back_cards.example_en: They rowed a boat across the lake.

back_cards.definition_en: A vehicle for leisure or fishing.
back_cards.example_en: He bought a boat for weekend trips.

back_cards.definition_en: A craft used for transportation.
back_cards.example_en: The boat carried supplies to the island.

back_cards.definition_en: A term for any waterborne vessel.
back_cards.example_en: The harbor was full of boats.

back_cards.definition_en: A life-saving craft on a ship.
back_cards.example_en: The crew escaped in the life boat.

back_cards.definition_en: A particular part or feature of something.
back_cards.example_en: They discussed every aspect of the plan.

back_cards.definition_en: A perspective or point of view.
back_cards.example_en: Her aspect on the issue was unique.

back_cards.definition_en: The appearance or look of something.
back_cards.example_en: The house had a charming aspect.

back_cards.definition_en: A specific phase or element.
back_cards.example_en: The financial aspect worried the team.

back_cards.definition_en: The orientation or direction something faces.
back_cards.example_en: The room’s southern aspect brought sunlight.

back_cards.definition_en: To quickly seize or take something.
back_cards.example_en: She grabbed her coat before leaving.

back_cards.definition_en: To attract attention or interest.
back_cards.example_en: The headline grabbed everyone’s attention.

back_cards.definition_en: To take an opportunity suddenly.
back_cards.example_en: He grabbed the chance to travel abroad.

back_cards.definition_en: To snatch or take roughly.
back_cards.example_en: The thief grabbed her purse and ran.

back_cards.definition_en: To quickly get or consume something.
back_cards.example_en: Let’s grab a coffee before the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: Up to the time or point that.
back_cards.example_en: She waited until the rain stopped.

back_cards.definition_en: Before a specified time or event.
back_cards.example_en: The store is closed until Monday.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicating the duration of an action.
back_cards.example_en: They worked until midnight to finish.

back_cards.definition_en: Marking the end of a period.
back_cards.example_en: The offer is valid until December.

back_cards.definition_en: To the place or extent that.
back_cards.example_en: He followed the path until the river.

back_cards.definition_en: Preferred or liked above others.
back_cards.example_en: Chocolate is her favorite ice cream flavor.

back_cards.definition_en: Most cherished or enjoyed.
back_cards.example_en: This is my favorite book of all time.

back_cards.definition_en: Chosen as the best or most liked.
back_cards.example_en: He’s the favorite candidate for the role.

back_cards.definition_en: Frequently selected or used.
back_cards.example_en: That café is their favorite weekend spot.

back_cards.definition_en: Held in high regard or affection.
back_cards.example_en: Her favorite memory was the family trip.

back_cards.definition_en: To enjoy or find something pleasant.
back_cards.example_en: She likes to read novels in the evening.

back_cards.definition_en: To approve of or prefer something.
back_cards.example_en: He likes his coffee with sugar.

back_cards.definition_en: To show support or interest online.
back_cards.example_en: They liked her post on social media.

back_cards.definition_en: To feel affection or attraction.
back_cards.example_en: The kids like their new teacher.

back_cards.definition_en: To want or wish for something.
back_cards.example_en: I’d like to visit the museum tomorrow.

back_cards.definition_en: The first month of the year.
back_cards.example_en: They planned a trip for January.

back_cards.definition_en: A time associated with new beginnings.
back_cards.example_en: January is perfect for setting goals.

back_cards.definition_en: A period of cold weather in some regions.
back_cards.example_en: January brought heavy snow to the city.

back_cards.definition_en: A reference to events in that month.
back_cards.example_en: The sale starts in January.

back_cards.definition_en: A term for annual cycles or plans.
back_cards.example_en: Their budget resets every January.

back_cards.definition_en: Free from control or influence of others.
back_cards.example_en: She started an independent business last year.

back_cards.definition_en: Not relying on others for support.
back_cards.example_en: He became independent after moving out.

back_cards.definition_en: Separate or distinct from something else.
back_cards.example_en: The study was conducted by an independent team.

back_cards.definition_en: Capable of thinking or acting alone.
back_cards.example_en: Her independent spirit inspired others.

back_cards.definition_en: Not connected to a larger system.
back_cards.example_en: They live in an independent community.

back_cards.definition_en: The amount of space something occupies.
back_cards.example_en: The box has a volume of ten cubic feet.

back_cards.definition_en: The loudness or intensity of sound.
back_cards.example_en: She turned up the volume on the radio.

back_cards.definition_en: A book forming part of a set or series.
back_cards.example_en: He read the first volume of the trilogy.

back_cards.definition_en: The quantity or amount of something.
back_cards.example_en: The volume of work increased this month.

back_cards.definition_en: A single book or published work.
back_cards.example_en: The library added a new volume to its collection.

back_cards.definition_en: First person singular of the verb 'to be'.
back_cards.example_en: I am happy to join the team.

back_cards.definition_en: Indicating identity or profession.
back_cards.example_en: I am a teacher at the local school.

back_cards.definition_en: Describing a current state or feeling.
back_cards.example_en: I am tired after the long day.

back_cards.definition_en: Expressing location or presence.
back_cards.example_en: I am at the park with friends.

back_cards.definition_en: Affirming existence or occurrence.
back_cards.example_en: I am here to help with the project.
